title: Grade 1
subject: College and Career Ready Standards for Literacy (CCRSL)(2017-)

document.title: DoDEA College and Career Ready Standards for English Language Arts & Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects CCRSL Grades Kindergarten - Five

CF496226868E42979952C2C8E77C395D.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading
and being read to, and responding to texts, including using
frequently occurring conjunctionsto signalsimple relationships
(e.g., because).

F09893B243D64CE2934C2D041BD6A26A.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in
manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and
adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by
defining or choosing them or by acting out the meanings.

0913CE08B4DC4DC79277EF67698CDB47.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use
(e.g., note places at home that are cozy).

EEADBB7A88F64AB79B31D709176CA9CE.description:
Define words by category and by one or more key
attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a tiger is a large
cat with stripes).

FCB79A897CA64A49AB31F865812C055A.description:
Sort wordsinto categories(e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a
sense of the conceptsthe categoriesrepresent.

4465B867F5CC4E3DAC0CA4EFAB54F8EC.description:
With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate
understanding of word relationships and nuancesin word
meanings.

A1C889E28D994762885795601462B3F0.description:
Identify frequently occurring root words(e.g., look) and
their inflectional forms(e.g., looks, looked, looking).

6314A04296FC4FD4A9DD8082E976B90A.description:
Use frequently occurring affixes as a clue to the meaning of
a word.

FF8409D804D3459A8CA16B1079E8D1E3.description:
Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a
word or phrase.

BBA21895E3824442AB926ED9A54B1327.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and
content, choosing flexibly from an array ofstrategies.

99074C84386649B3998CD60108B683EA.description:
Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on phonemic
awareness and spelling conventions.

3301C9C310AB4169BD0FB47CDFC2F69E.description:
Use conventionalspelling for words with common spelling
patterns and for frequently occurring irregular words.

67C1E08E94A34FA481635EB2EF137072.description:
Use commas in dates and to separate single wordsin a
series.

A55ECA828239427986EDB52CC5B5F48A.description: Capitalize dates and names of people.

A0C4E77B1E034078A856D516C1488110.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions ofstandard English
capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

4568654876B140E8AB486BF65F1B4663.description:
Produce and expand complete simple and compound
declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory
sentencesin response to prompts.

E7FE978E588F42FAA25D4365A9529761.description:
Use frequently occurring prepositions(e.g., during, beyond,
toward).

75412DA6E269474687D7A536D1DC0D37.description:
Use frequently occurring conjunctions(e.g., and, but, or, so,
because).

BAF9BD00D89740D5B55E993F8FB7BE16.description:
Use personal, possessive, and indefinite pronouns
(e.g., I, me, my; they, them, their, anyone, everything).

C08228B8A83D469BB76EC2EC9F0E9CA7.description:
Use singular and plural nouns with matching verbs in basic
sentences(e.g., He hops; We hop).

3B233B7BBCA74A7FA94ED2D2DF8B0092.description: Use common, proper, and possessive nouns.

F58977E8920F4D02B0DB629C19388675.description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters.

6043D5D4CA4D44C4B18C12F9CD419811.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions ofstandard English
grammar and usage when writing orspeaking.

03A27A872DD1414CA011B8098C281AF7.description:
Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and
situation. (See grade 1 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific
expectations.)

4EDF2EF2061942D28D8172176CE467B2.description:
Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions when
appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

CA1BB0416435428CB835B7AEBA906603.description:
Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details,
expressing ideas and feelings clearly.

D31922C3314043C8B3EE4D5EBDA70C84.description:
Ask and answer questions about what a speakersays in order to
gather additional information or clarify something that is not
understood.

B8B316C7E0254C958C04FA3560976A68.description:
Ask and answer questions about key details in a text read aloud
or information presented orally or through other media.

0002F4F2368048A8BA53527FCC122716.description:
Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics
and texts under discussion.

3675F1D2C5DD4C0798FB2800785E39AB.description:
Build on others’ talk in conversations by responding to the
comments of othersthrough multiple exchanges.

22AE8E29D4234FD18F9EF1CDB2F1AF0B.description:
Follow agreed-upon rulesfor discussions(e.g., listening to
others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics
and texts under discussion).

3A2D274D74714BDBB904C91F5B26DCD3.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners
about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and
larger groups.

5EF3B69279FD4A30997978C00DC4B086.description:
With guidance and support from adults, recall information from
experiences or gather information from provided sourcesto
answer a question.

D9E7098E7A5041EC9DF1A30E3536F3A8.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects(e.g., explore a
number of "how-to" books on a given topic and use them to
write a sequence of instructions).

A7968EE1747F42C3B62A56AF151EEB81.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

4812DA9FCE4648C89BDBD83428B27006.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital
toolsto produce and publish writing, including in collaboration
with peers.

B36054CC9B0A45C8A488008B7E3EA396.description:
With guidance and support from adults, focus on a topic, respond
to questions and suggestionsfrom peers, and add detailsto
strengthen writing as needed.

5784B41F857143709CF8A7B579ADB207.description:
Write narratives in which they recount two or more
appropriately sequenced events, include some details regarding
what happened, use temporal words to signal event order, and
provide some sense of closure.

0016401299BF4421A4A88723135282A1.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic,
supply some facts about the topic, and provide some sense of
closure.

8315961AEBC64617966734999F6CA4D0.description:
Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or name
the book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply a
reason for the opinion, and provide some sense of closure.

BB5AD76F0E064F48B50B8B66737CB33C.description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters legibly.

FAECF4EE283A486CB3A35CFB18C725AD.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and
understanding, rereading as necessary.

172DD37E3D6F456C87C8BE31D955D4CB.description:
Read on-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate,
and expression on successive readings.

D0B478924E134CCBAE71EB697E5A5B33.description: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.

49A647684E944E94B63838E42065D28A.description:
Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support
comprehension.

AF6917341DD841C890467D78FF62843D.description:
Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled
words.

D7ACE9B647D84F0F9A35E48D52FD5DFF.description:
Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by
breaking the words into syllables.

6D40FBB20F5744DAAC2E7230059FBA9E.description:
Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel
sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed
word.

E73E39A5933B416DB311D7D8CF50DD95.description:
Know final -e and common vowel team conventions for
representing long vowel sounds.

C7755B64159547E8990D0F4844E7D11E.description:
Know the spelling-sound correspondences for common
consonant digraphs.

15A286FB4E85450DBA8222BE8AFF9BF6.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in
decoding words.

78709FFB2FC6477AB14E547265A822FD.description:
Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds
(phonemes).

44CFE18FC2104989939FA47089281156.description: Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and finalsounds (phonemes) in spoken singlesyllable words.

C496A21F5AC84FF2BDCD1450A0C319B5.description:
Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds(phonemes), including consonant
blends.

7CCF988C7EA94845BF8862CD61BA6C4F.description: Distinguish long from short vowel soundsin spoken single-syllable words.

7E9F6FE79E0D4ABAA9FEB6F23C6266B5.description: Demonstrate understanding ofspoken words,syllables, and sounds(phonemes).

FE7DF5EE9CDB4C148810764ADD9BEBAD.description:
Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending
punctuation).

41F4A5D0B126460B94BF19BB3B792824.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

146520AE4D284B72926F221AB762AF64.description:
With prompting and support, read informational texts
appropriately complex for grade 1.

54AF092DD61E4FBFB996A623DFF640D8.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

2F0576D7813C4A4295124EA22F7CF8E2.description:
Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts
on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or
procedures).

F470FEA74B37423EA5DCE318BE8C70B8.description: Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

5E4AC9F484064A81925F5B7201D40519.description: Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key ideas.

00C0D0ABE90D4D23A6C8453C7141BC2D.description:
Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other
illustrations and information provided by the words in a text.

5CB331D1253A4B019283A0BE495896CC.description:
Know and use varioustext features(e.g., headings, tables of
contents, glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts
or information in a text.

C8394BC15BD244BE9C858D5C0B6ABB6E.description:
Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the
meaning of words and phrasesin a text.

0DEE81103929466A8CA8679645860D71.description:
Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas,
or pieces of information in a text.

24E6C5DC4C6C468A9513B72D178152CD.description: Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

A4D855600FD84E2E83CE28C99661206C.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

7932AA59F85048828B4BF54A519BCDB7.description:
With prompting and support, read prose and poetry of
appropriate complexity for grade 1.

8358D04C387149F580369208219FC92A.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

6F8AFF8729914404B0BFE10B789FCAC0.description:
Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of
charactersin stories.

720579D60B3D4754B627FC0BA647187C.description:
Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters,
setting, or events.

47DF2BE63FC74166AE374E61EBA0C335.description: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

45CFC77F8DEF455D97291B1FE52D629F.description:
Explain major differences between booksthat tellstories and
booksthat give information, drawing on a wide reading of a
range of text types.

B3707DD44B6847D8ADB74724875D5093.description:
Identify words and phrases in stories or poemsthatsuggest
feelings or appeal to the senses.

9C0756D804ED4B8C9DA735FB0A54CC63.description:
Describe characters, settings, and major events in a story, using
key details.

51D65C45C4DC42DC91F9F8DAF76CEC0E.description:
Retell stories, including key details, and demonstrate
understanding of their central message or lesson.

7B157636D89D4D969B810D246C458BF8.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
